data.text: @JoekillianPW The true death count is definitely undercounted. During the pandemic I've watched Dr. Kat, Epidemiologist on TikTok. She explained the estimated and expected death rates in 2020 NYC were woefully inaccurate given reported deaths, even if certs didn't list COVID. #PreTesting

@JoekillianPW @tictactigress Yeah, I've had that happen, especially when I wear the ones with filters. Sounds like I'm talking with my mouth full 😂.

I work 2 jobs, and the one in the evening is for UPS where I'm in a tough environment for 3-4 hrs w/ a mask, so I guess I've gotten used to the discomfort

@MaiqTheFryer @tictactigress The only negatives I have experienced have been a bit of mask exhaustion when I've had (infrequently) wear one for an 8-10 hour stretch and occasionally having people have a slightly harder time understanding what I'm saying if I'm speaking to a group in person.

Fair trade.

@tictactigress @JoekillianPW Yeah. I'm gonna wear mine forever. Wherever I'm in close proximity to ppl. For me, the benefits, from fewer allergic reactions to less random illnesses, to less *everything, far outweigh the nonexistent negatives.
@JoekillianPW @MaiqTheFryer They dropped mask mandates at work I still wear mine. Last time this happened, we were back to wearing them in two months anyway.

@riggsbeem I am too, for a number of reasons. My father just completed chemo. My brother-in-law is still doing it. But in addition to seeing what seems like the vast majority of people in my area stop as soon as there was not a mandate, I now find myself havi g to explain it more.
